cancer_sites.name: Breast Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes clinical and pathological nodal staging.

T.Tis (Paget): Paget disease of the nipple NOT associated with invasive carcinoma and/or DCIS
T.T1a: Tumor > 1 mm but ≤ 5 mm in greatest dimension
T.T1b: Tumor > 5 mm but ≤ 10 mm in greatest dimension
T.T1c: Tumor > 10 mm but ≤ 20 mm in greatest dimension
T.T2: Tumor > 20 mm but ≤ 50 mm in greatest dimension
T.T4: Tumor of any size with direct extension to chest wall and/or skin
T.T4b: Ulceration and/or ipsilateral satellite nodules and/or edema

N.cNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.cN1: Metastasis to movable ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph node(s)
N.cN2: Metastases in ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph nodes fixed or matted; or in ipsilateral internal mammary nodes
N.cN2a: Metastases in ipsilateral level I, II axillary lymph nodes fixed to one another or other structures
N.cN2b: Metastases only in ipsilateral internal mammary nodes
N.cN3: Metastases in ipsilateral infraclavicular (level III axillary) lymph node(s), with or without level I, II axillary or internal mammary involvement; or in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph node(s)
N.cN3a: Metastasis in ipsilateral infraclavicular lymph node(s)
N.cN3b: Metastasis in ipsilateral internal mammary lymph node(s) and axillary lymph node(s)
N.cN3c: Metastasis in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph node(s)

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN0(i): No regional lymph node metastases histologically, negative IHC
Niclas.pN0(mol-): No regional lymph node metastases histologically, negative molecular findings
Niclas.pN1: Micrometastases; or metastases in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes and/or internal mammary nodes
Niclas.pN1b: Metastases in ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes
Niclas.pN1c: Metastases in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes and in internal mammary sentinel nodes
Niclas.pN2: Metastases in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes; or positive ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes by imaging
Niclas.pN2b: Clinically detected metastases in internal mammary lymph nodes
Niclas.pN3: Metastases in ≥ 10 axillary lymph nodes; or in infraclavicular lymph nodes; or positive ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes by imaging with axillary metastases
Niclas.pN3a: Metastases in ≥ 10 axillary lymph nodes; or metastases to the infraclavicular lymph nodes
Niclas.pN3b: pN1a or pN2a in the presence of cN2b or pN1b
Niclas.pN3c: Metastases in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes

M.cM0(i+): No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastases in presence of tumor cells or deposits ≤ 0.2 mm
M.cM1: Distant metastases detected by clinical and radiographic means
M.pM1: Any histologically proven metastases in distant organs

cancer_sites.name: Lung Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes clinical and pathological nodal staging.

T.T1: Tumor ≤ 3 cm in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura
T.T1b: Tumor > 1 cm but ≤ 2 cm in greatest dimension
T.T1c: Tumor > 2 cm but ≤ 3 cm in greatest dimension
T.T2: Tumor > 3 cm but ≤ 5 cm or involves main bronchus, visceral pleura
T.T2a: Tumor > 3 cm but ≤ 4 cm in greatest dimension
T.T2b: Tumor > 4 cm but ≤ 5 cm in greatest dimension
T.T3: Tumor > 5 cm but ≤ 7 cm or invades parietal pleura, chest wall, phrenic nerve, or separate tumor nodule in same lobe
T.T4: Tumor > 7 cm or invades diaphragm, mediastinum, heart, great vessels, trachea, or separate tumor nodule in different ipsilateral lobe

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N1: Metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and/or hilar lymph nodes
N.N2: Metastasis in ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal lymph nodes
N.N3: Metastasis in contralateral mediastinal, hilar, or supraclavicular lymph nodes

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN1: Metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and/or hilar lymph nodes
Niclas.pN2: Metastasis in ipsilateral mediastinal and/or subcarinal lymph nodes
Niclas.pN3: Metastasis in contralateral mediastinal, hilar, or supraclavicular lymph nodes

M.M1a: Separate tumor nodule in contralateral lung; tumor with pleural nodules or malignant pleural effusion

cancer_sites.name: Colorectal Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes clinical and pathological nodal staging.

T.T3: Tumor invades through muscularis propria into pericolorectal tissues
T.T4: Tumor penetrates to surface of visceral peritoneum or invades other organs
T.T4a: Tumor penetrates to surface of visceral peritoneum
T.T4b: Tumor directly invades or adheres to other organs or structures

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N1c: Tumor deposit(s) in subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic tissues without regional nodal metastasis

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN1c: Tumor deposit(s) in subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic tissues without regional nodal metastasis

M.M1a: Metastasis to one site or organ
M.M1b: Metastasis to multiple sites or organs

cancer_sites.name: Prostate Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes clinical and pathological nodal staging.

T.T1a: Tumor incidental in ≤ 5% of tissue resected
T.T1b: Tumor incidental in > 5% of tissue resected
T.T2a: Tumor involves ≤ half of one lobe
T.T2b: Tumor involves > half of one lobe but not both lobes
T.T4: Tumor invades adjacent structures other than seminal vesicles

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

M.M1c: Other site(s) with or without bone disease

cancer_sites.name: Ovarian Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition) and FIGO system, as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1: Tumor limited to the ovaries (one or both)
T.T1a: Tumor limited to one ovary; capsule intact, no tumor on ovarian surface; no malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings
T.T1b: Tumor limited to both ovaries; capsules intact, no tumor on ovarian surface; no malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings
T.T1c: Tumor limited to one or both ovaries with any of the subcategories below
T.T1c2: Capsule ruptured before surgery or tumor on ovarian or fallopian tube surface
T.T1c3: Malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings
T.T2: Tumor involves one or both ovaries with pelvic extension below pelvic brim
T.T2a: Extension and/or implants on the uterus and/or tube(s)
T.T2b: Extension to and/or implants in other pelvic tissues
T.T3: Tumor involves one or both ovaries with microscopically confirmed peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis and/or retroperitoneal lymph node involvement
T.T3a: Microscopic peritoneal metastasis beyond the pelvis with or without positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes
T.T3b: Macroscopic peritoneal metastasis beyond the pelvis ≤2 cm in greatest dimension with or without positive retroperitoneal lymph nodes
T.T3c: Macroscopic peritoneal metastasis beyond the pelvis >2 cm in greatest dimension including extension to liver capsule or spleen without parenchymal involvement

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤0.2 mm

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤0.2 mm

M.M1: Distant metastasis including cytology-positive pleural effusion; liver or splenic parenchymal involvement; extra-abdominal organ involvement
M.M1b: Liver or splenic parenchymal metastases; metastases to extra-abdominal organs

FIGO.IA: Tumor limited to one ovary; capsule intact, no tumor on ovarian surface; no malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings
FIGO.IB: Tumor limited to both ovaries; capsules intact, no tumor on ovarian surface; no malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings
FIGO.IC: Tumor limited to one or both ovaries with any of the subcategories below
FIGO.IC2: Capsule ruptured before surgery or tumor on ovarian or fallopian tube surface
FIGO.IC3: Malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings
FIGO.IIA: Extension and/or implants on the uterus and/or tube(s)
FIGO.IIB: Extension to and/or implants in other pelvic tissues
FIGO.IIIA2: Microscopic peritoneal metastasis beyond the pelvis
FIGO.IIIB: Macroscopic peritoneal metastasis beyond the pelvis ≤2 cm
FIGO.IIIC: Macroscopic peritoneal metastasis beyond the pelvis >2 cm
FIGO.IVB: Liver or splenic parenchymal metastases; metastases to extra-abdominal organs

cancer_sites.name: Cervical Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition) and FIGO system, as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1a: Invasive carcinoma diagnosed only by microscopy
T.T1a2: Stromal invasion > 3 mm but ≤ 5 mm in depth
T.T1b: Clinically visible lesion confined to cervix or microscopic lesion > T1a
T.T1b1: Clinically visible lesion ≤ 4 cm in greatest dimension
T.T1b2: Clinically visible lesion > 4 cm in greatest dimension
T.T2: Tumor invades beyond uterus but not to pelvic wall or lower third of vagina
T.T3: Tumor extends to pelvic wall, involves lower third of vagina, or causes hydronephrosis
T.T3a: Tumor involves lower third of vagina
T.T3b: Tumor extends to pelvic wall or causes hydronephrosis
T.T4: Tumor invades mucosa of bladder or rectum or extends beyond true pelvis

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤ 0.2 mm

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤ 0.2 mm

FIGO.IA: Invasive carcinoma diagnosed only by microscopy
FIGO.IA2: Stromal invasion > 3 mm but ≤ 5 mm in depth
FIGO.IB: Clinically visible lesion confined to cervix or microscopic lesion > IA
FIGO.IB1: Clinically visible lesion ≤ 4 cm in greatest dimension
FIGO.IB2: Clinically visible lesion > 4 cm in greatest dimension
FIGO.IIIA: Tumor involves lower third of vagina
FIGO.IIIB: Tumor extends to pelvic wall or causes hydronephrosis
FIGO.IVA: Tumor invades mucosa of bladder or rectum or extends beyond true pelvis

cancer_sites.name: Endometrial Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition) and FIGO system, as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1a: Tumor limited to endometrium or invades less than half of myometrium
T.T1b: Tumor invades half or more of myometrium
T.T2: Tumor invades cervical stroma but does not extend beyond uterus
T.T4: Tumor invades bladder and/or bowel mucosa

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤ 0.2 mm
N.N1: Regional lymph node metastasis to pelvic lymph nodes
N.N2: Regional lymph node metastasis to para-aortic lymph nodes

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤ 0.2 mm
Niclas.pN1: Regional lymph node metastasis to pelvic lymph nodes
Niclas.pN2: Regional lymph node metastasis to para-aortic lymph nodes

FIGO.IA: Tumor limited to endometrium or invades less than half of myometrium
FIGO.IB: Tumor invades half or more of myometrium
FIGO.II: Tumor invades cervical stroma but does not extend beyond uterus
FIGO.IIIC1: Regional lymph node metastasis to pelvic lymph nodes
FIGO.IIIC2: Regional lymph node metastasis to para-aortic lymph nodes
FIGO.IVA: Tumor invades bladder and/or bowel mucosa

cancer_sites.name: Pancreatic Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1b: Tumor > 0.5 cm and ≤ 1 cm in greatest dimension
T.T1c: Tumor > 1 cm but ≤ 2 cm in greatest dimension
T.T2: Tumor > 2 cm but ≤ 4 cm in greatest dimension
T.T4: Tumor involves celiac axis, superior mesenteric artery, or common hepatic artery

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

cancer_sites.name: Melanoma
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1b: Tumor < 0.8 mm with ulceration or 0.8-1 mm
T.T2: Tumor > 1 mm but ≤ 2 mm in thickness
T.T2a: Tumor > 1 mm but ≤ 2 mm without ulceration
T.T2b: Tumor > 1 mm but ≤ 2 mm with ulceration
T.T3: Tumor > 2 mm but ≤ 4 mm in thickness
T.T3a: Tumor > 2 mm but ≤ 4 mm without ulceration
T.T3b: Tumor > 2 mm but ≤ 4 mm with ulceration
T.T4b: Tumor一提したように > 4 mm with ulceration

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N1: Metastasis in one regional lymph node or intralymphatic regional metastasis without nodal metastasis
N.N1a: Clinically occult metastasis in one regional lymph node
N.N1b: Clinically detected metastasis in one regional lymph node
N.N1c: No regional lymph node metastasis but with in-transit, satellite, or microsatellite metastases
N.N2: Metastasis in 2-3 regional lymph nodes or intralymphatic regional metastasis with one nodal metastasis
N.N2a: Clinically occult metastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes
N.N2b: Clinically detected metastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes
N.N2c: One clinically occult or detected lymph node with in-transit, satellite, or microsatellite metastases
N.N3: Metastasis in ≥ 4 regional lymph nodes or matted nodes with intralymphatic metastases
N.N3a: Clinically occult metastases in ≥ 4 regional lymph nodes
N.N3b: Clinically detected metastases in ≥ 4 regional lymph nodes
N.N3c: ≥ 2 clinically occult or detected lymph nodes and/or matted nodes with in-transit, satellite, or microsatellite metastases

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN1: Metastasis in one regional lymph node
Niclas.pN1a: Clinically occult metastasis in one regional lymph node
Niclas.pN1b: Clinically detected metastasis in one regional lymph node
Niclas.pN1c: No regional lymph node metastasis but with in-transit, satellite, or microsatellite metastases
Niclas.pN2a: Clinically occult metastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes
Niclas.pN2b: Clinically detected metastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes
Niclas.pN2c: One clinically occult or detected lymph node with in-transit, satellite, or microsatellite metastases
Niclas.pN3: Metastasis in ≥ 4 regional lymph nodes or matted nodes
Niclas.pN3a: Clinically occult metastases in ≥ 4 regional lymph nodes
Niclas.pN3b: Clinically detected metastases in ≥ 4 regional lymph nodes
Niclas.pN3c: ≥ 2 clinically occult or detected lymph nodes and/or matted nodes with in-transit, satellite, or microsatellite metastases

M.M1a: Metastasis to skin, subcutaneous tissue, or nonregional lymph nodes

cancer_sites.name: Head and Neck Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging. Excludes HPV-mediated oropharyngeal cancer.

Oral Cavity.T2: Tumor > 2 cm but ≤ 4 cm in greatest dimension
Oral Cavity.T3: Tumor > 4 cm in greatest dimension or extension to lingual surface of epiglottis
Oral Cavity.T4a: Tumor invades adjacent structures (e.g., cortical bone, deep muscle of tongue, maxillary sinus, skin)
Oral Cavity.T4b: Tumor invades masticator space, pterygoid plates, or skull base, or encases internal carotid artery

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N1: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, ≤ 3 cm, no extranodal extension
N.N2: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, > 3 cm but ≤ 6 cm, or multiple ipsilateral, contralateral, or bilateral lymph nodes, none > 6 cm
N.N2a: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, > 3 cm but ≤ 6 cm, no extranodal extension
N.N2b: Metastasis in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none > 6 cm, no extranodal extension
N.N2c: Metastasis in contralateral or bilateral lymph nodes, none > 6 cm, no extranodal extension
N.N3: Metastasis in a lymph node > 6 cm or with extranodal extension
N.N3a: Metastasis in a lymph node > 6 cm, no extranodal extension

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN1: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, ≤ 3 cm, no extranodal extension
Niclas.pN2: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, > 3 cm but ≤ 6 cm, or multiple ipsilateral, contralateral, or bilateral lymph nodes, none > 6 cm
Niclas.pN2a: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, > 3 cm but ≤ 6 cm, no extranodal extension
Niclas.pN2b: Metastasis in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none > 6 cm, no extranodal extension
Niclas.pN2c: Metastasis in contralateral or bilateral lymph nodes, none > 6 cm, no extranodal extension
Niclas.pN3: Metastasis in a lymph node > 6 cm or with extranodal extension
Niclas.pN3a: Metastasis in a lymph node > 6 cm, no extranodal extension

cancer_sites.name: Bladder Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T4a: Tumor invades prostate, uterus, or vagina
T.T4b: Tumor invades pelvic wall or abdominal wall

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N1: Metastasis in a single lymph node in true pelvis
N.N2: Metastasis in multiple lymph nodes in true pelvis
N.N3: Metastasis in common iliac lymph node(s)

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN1: Metastasis in a single lymph node in true pelvis
Niclas.pN2: Metastasis in multiple lymph nodes in true pelvis
Niclas.pN3: Metastasis in common iliac lymph node(s)

cancer_sites.name: Kidney Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1: Tumor ≤ 7 cm in greatest dimension, confined to kidney
T.T1b: Tumor > 4 cm but ≤ 7 cm in greatest dimension
T.T2: Tumor > 7 cm in greatest dimension, confined to kidney
T.T2a: Tumor > 7 cm but ≤ 10 cm in greatest dimension
T.T3: Tumor extends into major veins or perinephric tissues
T.T3a: Tumor extends into renal vein or perinephric tissues
T.T3b: Tumor extends into vena cava below diaphragm
T.T3c: Tumor extends into vena cava above diaphragm or invades vena cava wall
T.T4: Tumor invades beyond Gerota fascia or ipsilateral adrenal gland

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

cancer_sites.name: Liver Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1: Solitary tumor ≤ 2 cm or > 2 cm without vascular invasion
T.T1b: Solitary tumor > 2 cm without vascular invasion
T.T2: Solitary tumor > 2 cm with vascular invasion or multiple tumors, none > 5 cm
T.T3: Multiple tumors, at least one > 5 cm
T.T4: Tumor(s) involving major branch of portal or hepatic vein or direct invasion of adjacent organs

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

cancer_sites.name: Stomach Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1: Tumor invades lamina propria or submucosa
T.T4: Tumor invades serosa or adjacent structures

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

cancer_sites.name: Esophageal Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1: Tumor invades lamina propria or submucosa
T.T1a: Tumor invades mucosa or lamina propria
T.T4a: Tumor invades pleura, pericardium, or diaphragm

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

cancer_sites.name: Thyroid Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1: Tumor ≤ 2 cm in greatest dimension, limited to thyroid
T.T1b: Tumor > 1 cm but ≤ 2 cm in greatest dimension
T.T2: Tumor > 2 cm but ≤ 4 cm in greatest dimension, limited to thyroid
T.T3: Tumor > 4 cm or with minimal extrathyroidal extension
T.T3b: Tumor with gross extrathyroidal extension invading only strap muscles
T.T4a: Tumor invades skin, larynx, trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve
T.T4b: Tumor invades prevertebral fascia, carotid artery, or mediastinal vessels

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N0a: One or more cytologically or histologically confirmed benign lymph nodes
N.N0b: No radiologic or clinical evidence of locoregional lymph node metastasis
N.N1a: Metastasis to level VI or VII lymph nodes
N.N1b: Metastasis to unilateral, bilateral, or contralateral lateral neck lymph nodes

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN0a: One or more cytologically or histologically confirmed benign lymph nodes
Niclas.pN0b: No histologic evidence of locoregional lymph node metastasis
Niclas.pN1a: Metastasis to level VI or VII lymph nodes
Niclas.pN1b: Metastasis to unilateral, bilateral, or contralateral lateral neck lymph nodes

cancer_sites.name: Testicular Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging and serum markers.

T.T1: Tumor limited to testis and epididymis without vascular/lymphatic invasion
T.T2: Tumor limited to testis and epididymis with vascular/lymphatic invasion or extending through tunica albuginea

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N1: Metastasis with lymph node mass ≤ 2 cm or multiple lymph nodes, none > 2 cm
N.N2: Metastasis with lymph node mass > 2 cm but ≤ 5 cm or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass > 2 cm but ≤ 5 cm
N.N3: Metastasis with lymph node mass > 5 cm

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN1: Metastasis with lymph node mass ≤ 2 cm or multiple lymph nodes, none > 2 cm
Niclas.pN2: Metastasis with lymph node mass > 2 cm but ≤ 5 cm or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass > 2 cm but ≤ 5 cm
Niclas.pN3: Metastasis with lymph node mass > 5 cm

S.S0: Serum marker levels within normal limits
S.S1: LDH < 1.5 × upper limit, hCG < 5,000 IU/L, AFP < 1,000 ng/mL
S.S2: LDH 1.5-10 × upper limit, hCG 5,000-50,000 IU/L, AFP 1,000-10,000 ng/mL
S.S3: LDH > 10 × upper limit, hCG > 50,000 IU/L, AFP > 10,000 ng/mL

cancer_sites.name: Penile Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition), as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1a: Tumor invades subepithelial connective tissue without lymphovascular invasion or perineural invasion, not poorly differentiated
T.T1b: Tumor invades subepithelial connective tissue with lymphovascular invasion or perineural invasion, or is poorly differentiated
T.T2: Tumor invades corpus spongiosum with or without urethral invasion
T.T3: Tumor invades corpus cavernosum with or without urethral invasion

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N1: Metastasis in one or two inguinal lymph nodes
N.N2: Metastasis in more than two unilateral inguinal nodes or bilateral inguinal nodes
N.N3: Metastasis in pelvic lymph node(s) or extranodal extension of regional lymph node metastasis

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN1: Metastasis in one or two inguinal lymph nodes without extranodal extension
Niclas.pN2: Metastasis in more than two unilateral inguinal nodes or bilateral inguinal nodes without extranodal extension
Niclas.pN3: Metastasis in pelvic lymph node(s) or extranodal extension of regional lymph node metastasis

cancer_sites.name: Vulvar Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition) and FIGO system, as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T1: Tumor confined to vulva or perineum
T.T1a: Tumor ≤ 2 cm with stromal invasion ≤ 1 mm
T.T1b: Tumor > 2 cm or with stromal invasion > 1 mm
T.T2: Tumor of any size with extension to adjacent perineal structures (lower/distal third of urethra, lower/distal third of vagina, anus)
T.T3: Tumor of any size with extension to upper/proximal two-thirds of urethra, vagina, bladder mucosa, rectal mucosa, or fixed to pelvic bone

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤ 0.2 mm
N.N1: Regional lymph node metastasis with one or two lymph node metastases each < 5 mm or one lymph node metastasis ≥ 5 mm
N.N1a: One or two lymph node metastases each < 5 mm
N.N2: Regional lymph node metastasis with three or more lymph node metastases each < 5 mm, or two or more ≥ 5 mm, or with extranodal extension
N.N2a: Three or more lymph node metastases each < 5 mm
N.N2b: Two or more lymph node metastases ≥ 5 mm
N.N2c: Lymph node metastasis with extranodal extension
N.N3: Fixed or ulcerated regional lymph node metastasis

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤ 0.2 mm
Niclas.pN1: Regional lymph node metastasis with one or two lymph node metastases each < 5 mm or one lymph node metastasis ≥ 5 mm
Niclas.pN1a: One or two lymph node metastases each < 5 mm
Niclas.pN2: Regional lymph node metastasis with three or more lymph node metastases each < 5 mm, or two or more ≥ 5 mm, or with extranodal extension
Niclas.pN2a: Three or more lymph node metastases each < 5 mm
Niclas.pN2b: Two or more lymph node metastases ≥ 5 mm
Niclas.pN2c: Lymph node metastasis with extranodal extension
Niclas.pN3: Fixed or ulcerated regional lymph node metastasis

FIGO.IA: Tumor ≤ 2 cm with stromal invasion ≤ 1 mm, confined to vulva or perineum
FIGO.IB: Tumor > 2 cm or with stromal invasion > 1 mm, confined to vulva or perineum
FIGO.II: Tumor of any size with extension to adjacent perineal structures
FIGO.IIIA: Tumor of any size with one or two lymph node metastases each < 5 mm or one lymph node metastasis ≥ 5 mm
FIGO.IIIB: Tumor of any size with three or more lymph node metastases each < 5 mm or two or more ≥ 5 mm
FIGO.IIIC: Tumor of any size with lymph node metastasis with extranodal extension
FIGO.IVA: Tumor invades upper/proximal two-thirds of urethra, vagina, bladder mucosa, rectal mucosa, or fixed to pelvic bone, or fixed/ulcerated lymph node metastasis

cancer_sites.name: Vaginal Cancer
cancer_sites.description: Staging based on AJCC TNM system (8th edition) and FIGO system, as referenced in NCCN guidelines. Includes pathological nodal staging.

T.T2: Tumor invades paravaginal tissues but not to pelvic wall
T.T4: Tumor invades mucosa of bladder or rectum or extends beyond true pelvis

N.NX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
N.N0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤ 0.2 mm

Niclas.pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed
Niclas.pN0(i+): Isolated tumor cells in regional lymph node(s) ≤ 0.2 mm

FIGO.II: Tumor invades paravaginal tissues but not to pelvic wall
FIGO.III: Tumor extends to pelvic wall or regional lymph node metastasis
FIGO.IVA: Tumor invades mucosa of bladder or rectum or extends beyond true pelvis
